Time: The time in which the data point begins.
Summary: A human-readable summary describing the weather conditions for a given data point.
Icon: One of a set of icons to provide a visual display of what's happening. This could be one of: clear-day, clear-night, rain, snow, sleet, wind, fog, cloudy, partly-cloudy-day, partly-cloudy-night.
NearestStormDistance: The approximate distance to the nearest storm in kilometers or miles.
NearestStormBearing: The approximate direction in degrees in which a storm is travelling with 0° representing true north.
PrecipIntensity: The rate in which liquid precipitation is falling. This value is expressed in millimeters per hour or inches per hour.
PrecipIntensityError: The standard deviation of the precipitationIntensity.
PrecipProbability: The probability of precipitation occurring expressed as a value between 0 and 1 inclusive.
PrecipType: The type of precipitation occurring. If precipIntensity is greater than zero this property will have one of the following values: rain, snow or sleet otherwise the value will be none. sleet is defined as any precipitation which is neither rain nor snow.
Temperature: The air temperature in degrees Celsius or degrees Fahrenheit.
ApparentTemperature: Feels like temperature, including either humidex if the temperature is greater than 10C or wind chill if less than 10C.
DewPoint: The point in which the air temperature needs (assuming constant pressure) in order to reach a relative humidity of 100%. This is value is represented in degrees Celsius or Fahrenheit.
Humidity: Relative humidity expressed as a value between 0 and 1 inclusive. This is a percentage of the actual water vapor in the air compared to the total amount of water vapor that can exist at the current temperature.
Pressure: The sea-level pressure represented in hectopascals or millibars.
WindSpeed: The current wind speed in kilometres per hour or miles per hour.
WindGust: The wind gust in kilometres per hour or miles per hour.
WindBearing: The direction in which the wind is blowing in degrees with 0° representing true north.
CloudCover: Percentage of the sky that is covered in clouds.
UvIndex: The measure of UV radiation as represented as an index starting from 0. 0 to 2 is Low, 3 to 5 is Moderate, 6 and 7 is High, 8 to 10 is Very High and 11+ is considered extreme.
Visibility: The visibility in kilometres or miles. In the daily block the visibility is the average visibility for the day. This value is capped at 16 kilometres or 10 miles.
Ozone: The density of total atmospheric ozone at a given time in Dobson units.
PrecipAccumulation: The amount of liquid precipitation expected to fall over an hour or a day expressed in centimetres or inches.
